title: Hinduism
summary: Hinduism (/ˈhɪnduɪzəm/)[1] is an Indian religion and dharma, or way of life.[lower-alpha 1] It is the world's third-largest religion, with over 1.2 billion followers, or 15–16% of the global population, known as Hindus.[lower-alpha 2] The word Hindu is an exonym,[lower-alpha 3] and while Hinduism has been called the oldest religion in the world,[note 4] many practitioners refer to their religion as Sanātana Dharma (Sanskrit: सनातन धर्म, lit. ''the Eternal Dharma''), which refers to the idea that its origins lie beyond human history, as revealed in the Hindu texts.[lower-alpha 4] Another, though less fitting,[9] self-designation is Vaidika dharma,[lower-alpha 5] the 'dharma related to the Vedas.'[14]
